gurmukhi: byd pVY sm ko Pl hY bhu mMgn ko joaU dwn idvwvY ] kIn AkIn lKY Pl ho joaU AwiQq logn AMnu ijvwvY ]
transliteration: Bed Padai Sam Ko Phal Hai Bahu Manad Ko Jooo Daan Divaavai|| Keen Akeen Lakhai Phal Ho Jooo Aathit Logad Ann(u) Jivaavai||
translation: He, who given charity to a beggar, he received the reward of one reading of the Vedas; who gives to the stranger the food to eat, he receives many rewards;

gurmukhi: dwn lhY hmry jIA ko ieh ky sm n soaU Pl pwvY ] jo bn mY hmko jrrw iek eyk GrI Bgvwn idKwvY ]488]
transliteration: Daan Lahai Hamre Jeea Ko Eh Ke Sam Ko Na Sooo Phal Paavai|| Jo Ban Mai Hamko Jarraa Ik Ek Gharibhagvaan Dikhaavai||488||
translation: He, who can get us a sight of Krishna for a short while, he can undoubtedly have the gift of our life; he will not receive a more assuring reward than this.488.

gurmukhi: jwih BBICn lMk deI Aru dYqn ky kuip kY gn mwry ] pY iqnhU kib sXwm khY sB swDn rwK AswD sMGwry ]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Bhabheechhan Lank Daiar(u) Daitan Ke Koup(i) Kai Gad Mdare|| Pai Tinhoo Kabi Syaam Kahai Sabh Saadhan Raakh Asaadh Sanhdare||
translation: He, who gave Lanka to Vibishana and in great fury, killed the demons; the poet Shyam says that it was he who protected the saints and destroyed the wicked;

gurmukhi: so ieh jw hm qy Cp gXo AqhI kr kY sMg pRIq hmwry ] pwie pro khIXo bn BRwq kho hir jI ikh Er pDwry ]489]
transliteration: So Eh Jaa Ham Te Chhap Gyo At-hikar Kai San Preet Hamdare|| Paae Daro Kaheeyo Ban Bhraat Kaho Har(i) Jikih Or Padhdare||489||
translation: The same Krishna has given love to us, but has disappeared from our eyes; O forest-dwellers! We fall at your feet; tell us to which direction Krishan has gone.489.

gurmukhi: gÍwrn Koij rhI bn mY hir jI bn mY nhI Kojq pwey ] eyk ibcwr krXo mn mY iPr kY n gXo kbhUM auhu jwey ]
transliteration: Gvaaran Khoj(i) Rahiban Mai Har(i) Jiban Mai Nahikhojat Paae|| Ek Bichaar Daryo Man Mai Phir Kai Na Gado Kabhoon Uh(u) Jaae||
translation: The gopis searched for Krishna in the forest, but they could not find him; then they thought in their mind that he might have gone to that direction;

gurmukhi: Pyr iPrI mn mY ignqI kr pwrQ sUq kI for lgwey ] XO aupjI aupmw ckeI jnu Awvq hY kr mY iPr Dwey ]490]
transliteration: Pher Phiriman Mai Gintikar Paarath Soot Kidor Lagade|| Yau Oupjioupmaa Chakaijan(u) Aavat Hai Kar Mai Phir Dhaae||490||
translation: They again think in their mind and associate the string of their mind with that Krishna; the poet figuratively says about their running and thinking that they are running hither and thither like a female partridge.490.

gurmukhi: Awie kY FUF rhI soaU Taur qhwN Bgvwn n FUFq pwey ] ieau ju rhI sB hI cik kY jnu icqR ilKI piRiqmw Cib pwey ]
transliteration: Ooe Kai Dhoodh Rahisooo Tharur Tahaan Bhagvaan Na Dhoodhat Paae|| Io Ju Rahisabh Hipaae||
translation: The place where they go in search of Krishna, they do not find him the re and in this way like an idol of stone, they return in astonishment;

gurmukhi: Aaur aupwv krXo pun gÍwrn kwnH hI BIqir ic`q lgwey ] gwie auTI iqhky gun eyk bjwie auTI iek sÍwNg lgwey ]491]
transliteration: Aur Oupaav Daryo Poun Gvaaran Kaahn Hibheetar(i) Chitt Lagade|| Gade Outhitihke Goun Ek Bajaae Outhiik Svaan Lagade||491||
translation: Then they took another step and totally absorbed their mind in Krishna; someone sang his qualities and someone wore the impressive garb of Krishna.491.

gurmukhi: hoq bkI iek hoq qiRxwvRq eyk AGwsur hÍY kr DwvY ] hoie hrI iqn mY DiskY DrnI pr qwkhU mwr igrwvY ]
transliteration: Hot Bakiik Hot Trinaavrat Ek Aghaasur Hvai Kar Dhaavai|| Hoe Haritin Mai Dhas(i)kai Dharnidar Takauh Maar Giraavai||
translation: Someone assumed the garb of Bakasura, someone of Tranavrata and someone of Aghasura and some putting on the garb of Krishna attached them and threw them on the ground;

gurmukhi: kwnH so lwg rhXo iqn kO Aq hI mn nYk n CUtn pwvY ] ieau aupjI aupmw bnIAw jn swln ky ihq ror bnwvY ]492]
transliteration: Kaahn So Laag Rahyo Tin Kau At Himan Naik Na Chhodhtan Paavai|| Io Oupjioupmaa Baneeaa Jan Saalan Ke Hit Ror Banaavai||492||
translation: Their mind does not abandon Krishna even for an instant; it seems that someone may be endeavouring to relish the taste of meat in the taste of forest vegetables.492.
Speech of King Parikshat addressed to Shuka:
